comment: I think a lot of the reviews are too harsh. Don't get me wrong, this is a VERY hard class, it was my first C at KSU and in my senior semester, but it is not as bad as some people say. It definitely could be better, but not the worst. If you have another option, Id go for it, but if you need to take Dr. Williamson, get ready to read and study a LOT.
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy

comment: The worst professor I have had at KSU. I have a 3.9 GPA and this class was hard to even pass due to her lack of teaching. The exams did not match up AT ALL with the course material. She will not respond to your email so don't waste time sending one. Takes forever to grade assignments. DO NOT TAKE HER.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: The tests are extremely difficult. No study guide given or anything. Be prepared to read and memorize textbook
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy

comment: I completed this class during the summer (4week) and it was challenging. Don't take if you have another option but if you can suffer through it you can pass. Offers extra credit (which helped me get a A). Best advice to study! Find practice questions online(Quizelet) and practice over and over. Exams are closed note. She is a kind person but hard.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Teaches mostly through MindTap. Exams are difficult and I'm not sure if she goes back and grades written responses herself, meaning spelling errors are counted as wrong answers. Grading for things such as discussions take forever and she doesn't make it easy to navigate assignments that are due.

Horrible professor. She's all over the place, inconsistent with posting assignments/due dates, makes her course material impossible to navigate online, doesn't respond to emails, and very clearly doesn't respect that students have more than just one class, as evidenced by her bizarre posting schedule + the amount of assignments she gives at a time.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: She missed weeks of class, and when she came back, she basically gave up on teaching us. She frequently loses assignments and grades slowly, yet she'll assignment stuff like every class period. Her TAs do more work than her. Lazy professor. Doesn't respond to emails. Avoid her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: She gave up teaching us halfway through the semester. She is a slow grader, and she also missed weeks of class. I would definitely reconsider taking her because she seems like she doesn't care.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Dont even register.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: she gave up teaching halfway through the semester and missed weeks of class. class is always her reading off of her 100+ slides. and theres class participation every single day. so much work and 4 exams and a project

Was good at the beginning of the semester, then kind of stopped caring to teach us. Powerpoints have over 115 slides for each chapter. Gives daily participation grades. Not horrible but I would not take her again.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: If you have the option please dont take her. She has been the worst professor I have had during my time at kennesaw.
AWFUL DO NOT I REPEAT DO NOT EVER TAKE HER

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. Just trust me, it was definitely my worst class of college so far. Her slides are directly from the textbook and you have to show to get class participation, even though she barely teaches. The only reason I'm doing okay at best is because I took AP psych in high school, otherwise, I would have no idea what was going on.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: she gives participation grade so attendance is mandatory, but the class is so lecture heavy and you have to teach yourself or you will fail, there is just so much to learn for psych its a lot of memorization but she does offer extra credit at the end
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She was an okay professor. She wasn't really the best or the worst. She only read from her 100000 page powerpoints and had class participation every class that had to be turned in by the end of class. Tests were kind of hard too.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS UNLESS YOU NEED TO! During class, she only reads right off her 107 slideshow. The test are hard to study for. She sometimes gives practice questions but they are nothing like the test. You have to be in class every week because she does class participation questions that you answer through class and turn in at the end.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Williamson gives out so many assignments that will have almost nothing to do about what we talk about in class. She also grades the last paper EXTRA HARD!! Lastly, she rarely ever responds to emails so good luck if you need her to enter a grade!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Course is very much worth taking. Issues I ran into: -Not all assignments are posted early on. -Rubrics and instructions come at her leisure. In the case of class' essay/presentation assignment, the rubric came 2 days before the due date. It has taken her nearly a month to grade that same project. -The $150 book is not necessary. Info is on ppts
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Do not take her, she has soooo many mini assignments on top of 4 exams and a final project, and the final exam is cumulative. Also, she expects everyone to print everything which adds up to like 200 pages and is rude about it if you have difficulties even though SHE is the one asking for a lot. I went through two ink cartridges in this class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: By far the worst professor I've taken at Kennesaw State. There are four exams, each one you feel completely unprepared for. For the most part, the lecture is completely different from the exams. Really the study guide is as close as you can get to what the exam might resemble but that's a toss-up. Don't get me started on the assignments.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: She reads directly from the powerpoint slides for every. single. minute. of class. Always lets out exactly at end time, takes a 1-point class participation every class. The powerpoint info is word for word from the textbook. Tests are all multiple choice, study the powerpoints and and you'll pass. Offered extra credit at the end of the semester.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: If you are not good with lecture heavy professors, do not take this class. She mainly reads over powerpoints every day, each of them being at least 80 slides. If you are willing to teach yourself a lot of the material, then you should be fine. You cannot slack off, but she does give many extra credit opportunities. Not my kind of professor.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: For a memory-heavy subject, this prof was able to get in a lot of the content with her lectures. I skipped class only about 3 times, took notes on my phone, and passed easily. There is also a ton of extra credit. Highly recommend
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dont skip class, she gives an assignment every class and thats how she does attendance. Tests have a lot of information so study a lot. Gives a lot of extra credit opportunities towards the end of the semester. Overall a good teacher
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Lectures the entire duration of class, but makes it enjoyable! Hard tests, but they can be made easy with heavy memorization.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Her class really was not that hard. She is just very boring to listen to. Her PowerPoints are word for word from the book. You have to show up to class to get credit. Its very easy to get a B, just do the work.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Williamson's class revolves 100% on powerpoints. You will do the same routine every class, and it's extremely difficult to stay on top of things unless you teach yourself all the powerpoints. She does offer many extra credit opportunities and the final is optional which makes up for it if you do well on the other tests.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Tests are tough--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Williamson knows what she is talking about, but trying to keep up with her power points every class that are 185+ slides long is impossible. My class was huge so we never got the one on one experience. The teachers assistants for this class were horrible, and the planned study sessions were just that. Do not take her class if it's large.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: My least favorite professor ever. Reads straight from the PowerPoint. Take notes before coming to class because you wont be able to keep up. Talks very monotone and takes a participation grade every single day. If it werent for the participation grades I wouldnt have shown up for any classes except test days.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This professor gives you many opportunities to pass . Most test questions are straight forward as long as you read the book and look over the power points. Attendance was mandatory as she gave class participation grades.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This professor gives you many opportunities to pass (extra credit). Most test questions are straight forward as long as you read the book and look over the power points. Attendance was mandatory as she gave class participation grades.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: powerpoints are lengthy (about 300 slides per test) but, I find it helpful reading that than the textbook to prep for tests. Literally read over all the powerpoints before a test and you'll get an A. SHE PULLS HER TEST STRAIGHT FROM THE PP! idk why people are complaining that you have to memorize or it's too much info (which is obvi bc its college)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: All she does is read the powerpoints that are on d2l that you can read yourself, but grades for participation to come and listen to her read the 130 slides word for word. material isn't that hard, but you have to turn in class participation every class to get credit. 2 extra credit opportunities & u have to have class participation for it to count
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: she is lecture heavy, she expects you to memorize over 400 slide of information per test. if you miss a day you miss class participation. you have to buy the textbook so you can get launchpad which all the homework assignment are on. over all a nice person but just an awful teacher
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This class is a NO. do not take her. She reads from powerpoints EVERY CLASS. There is almost no extra credit. if you're going bad she won't help you. Each chapter is roughly 130 powerpoints. Must go to the class if you don't get participation points.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I took her class and it was overall good. Her test go exactly by the power points SHE DOES NOT TRY TO TRICK YOU. As long as you study the power point her test will look the same.4 tests the final is mandatory, no homework really and if you do get it once in a blue moon its for completion. has cool vids during class.  if you dont study you wont pass
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She's really sweet. I missed a lot of class and still did okay, attendance is not mandatory. She  covers a lot of material in class, so PRINT OUT THE POWERPOINTS that she posts before the lecture. There's 4 test and a final but you only have to take it if you miss one of those 4 tests. The only other grades are easy class participation assignments.

Lectures are long and boring, but make it easier to score high on the test. Read to textbook to reiterate the lectures. Tests are easy if you go over the powerpoints and study before the test. She gives class participation. Class attendance not mandatory but can be helpful when learning the information. Overall easy if you study for the tests.

The people below me are ridiculously wrong. You have to read the textbook, but if you do her class is super duper easy. She does do class participation, but I literally made 100s on all four tests. Just read the books and you will be perfectly fine! I promise!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Singlehandedly the most boring professor I've taken in school. She stood behind the computer the entire lecture everyday, and read verbatim from her power points. Random class participation was given. She reviewed the previous class for 20 minutes at the beginning of class, but wouldn't discuss topics because of a "lack of time." Textbook is a must
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She was the worst professor I took this semester. The class average was a 68 & I had not even heard of a person who made above a C on her exams. She does nothing but lecture & give tests. It is completely up to you to learn the material and she gives no homework or study guides to help you with the tests. DO NOT TAKE HER! please.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I wouldn't take her if I were you. she literally just reads powerpoints (which are 30-60 slides each & there are about 6 of them per test) for the entire class period & randomly gives points for class participation. Shes probably the most boring prof & there is no uniqueness in her teaching. Keep searching.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This professor made me want to never take psychology ever again. All she does in class is read powerpoints verbatim and is so boring you'll want to cry. Her tests are heavily based on the book (which is an INSANE amount of reading) but she has stuff thrown in that isn't anywhere to be found. She will do nothing to help you pass. Save yourselves.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY
